Job Title: Production Leader - Bottles BU - Dallas

Location: Dallas, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
About The Job

ABOUT THE JOB

At Danone, Manufacturing the best products and supplying them to meet demand is a key driver for our plant teams. We have an opening for Production Leader within our Bottles Business Unit in our Dallas, Texas beverage manufacturing facility. In this role, you will support the assigned business unit and will provide safety and servant-based leadership to achieve breakthrough business results. You will be accountable for driving out top losses on a 24-hour, multiple shift cycle through a rigorous Daily Direction Setting system and will specifically own Safety, Quality, System Performance, and CILs. This position is also accountable for weekly, monthly, and 90-day plan reviews.

The Production Leader owns ensuring the development of the operating teams’ technical capability. You will provide daily direction and coaching to your team to deliver breakthrough results and will ultimately be accountable for the results of the line/system. You will also be responsible for learning the other BU Leadership positions and must become able to fill their roles (RL and OPEX) in their short-term absence. You will be responsible for building capability in Operating Teams and Equipment Owners to deliver overall line results supporting the CBN.

Additionally In This Role You Will Be Responsible For

Owns Human and Food Safety for the line/system and the plan to improve. Single point of ownership for the delivery of the glidepath for the line/system. Facilitates development of the Line Master/90-Day Plans to address losses and build capability. Owns delivery of the line targeted resultsOwns DDS process includingLeading daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly – includes Recognition of team members. Development and execution of Plan for the Day – includes development and handoff of plan for 2nd and 3rd shifts. Health of CIL systemImplementation and evolution of Planned StopsFacilitates the DDS meetings. Facilitates the weekly foundational meetings. Builds capability in operators to identify, measure and drive out losses on their equipment. Provide ongoing performance feedback and coaching to team member. Own support of the developmental plan for the Line TeamOwning staffing concerns for all shifts and production schedule to execute results. Identifying training gaps for the operators/technicians on the system as well as developing and ensuring execution of training plan to address these gaps. Facilitates communication of the plan to the teams.  About you

About You

You have a high school diploma or GED, required. A bachelor's degree in engineering, business, food science or related field is preferred. Equivalent work experience and training will be considered in lieu of a completed degree. You have at least five years related experience within a manufacturing environment, required. Prior experience within a CPG manufacturing environment is preferred. You have experience leading teams in a fast-paced manufacturing environment, preferred. You have strategic ability to create, design, and implement improvements to current procedures. You can think quickly on your feet, especially in emergency situations. You have a solid understanding of safety rules, plant rules, GMP, and code of ethics and follow them strictly at all times. 

About us

About Us

At Danone North America, you’ll work with some of the best-known food and beverage brands in the world like Activia, Silk, Two Good, Oikos, evian, and Happy Family. You’ll be part of one of the largest Certified B Corp™ in the world, working together to make sure our brands create real benefits for people, communities, and the planet. We have 6,000+ employees across the U.S. and Canada. Come join our movement for a healthier world One Planet. One Health BY YOU.

Danone North America doesn’t just welcome what makes you unique, we value it. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All hires to our team are based on qualifications, merit and business needs. We recruit, employ, train and promote regardless of race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran status, genetic characteristic or any other protected status. Faithful to our values of openness and humanism, all of our employees share in the commitment to engage one another with dignity and respect.
